flashcards.kikuyu: Reversible Action Verb Pairs (Do and Undo)
flashcards.english: Hinga/Hîngûra (close/open), Anîka/Anûrra (spread/fold), Oha/Ohorania (tie/untie), Handũka/Hendekerania (straighten/bend), Amba/Ambûra (start/finish), Ingîra/Ekereria or Ekaria (go in/go out or take out), Iya/Inyia (put in/take out)
flashcards.notes: Systematic pattern showing verb pairs for reversible actions. Essential for describing complete processes. Some verbs have multiple forms for 'undo' action (e.g., Ekereria/Ekaria both mean 'take out')

flashcards.english: Thutha wa (after), Hamwe na (together with), Na (and), Îngî (also/again), Kwa mûhîano (for example), Kana (or), Rĩĩra rĩa (because of), Tondũ (because), No (then/so), Akiuga atĩrĩ (saying that)
flashcards.notes: Essential conjunctions for building complex sentences. Temporal (Thutha wa = after), Additive (Hamwe na, Na, Îngî), Logical (Tondũ, Rĩĩra rĩa = because), Exemplification (Kwa mûhîano), Choice (Kana), Result (No), Reported speech (Akiuga atĩrĩ)
